events.name: Intro to the African Tech Ecosystem
events.description:
Curious about what's happening in tech in Africa? 

We have assembled an exciting panel of African startups who will give you the low-down on entrepreneurial activities in their ecosystem. We'll be dishing inside scoop on how the African startup ecosystem works, including investors, movers and shakers, incubators, hot issues, and more.

This session is intended to help attendees understand the different players in the African startup ecosystem, where it’s heading, and which sectors are hot now. Come by for a great sharing session and drinks!

Speakers: 

Aaron Fu, Managing Partner - Africa, NEST
Leslie Onyesoh, CEO, Kwanji
Mary Mwangi, CEO, Data Integrated Limited
Kevin Mutiso, CEO and Co-Founder, Alternative Circle

Moderator: 
Aziza Sheerin, Regional Director, Singapore, General Assembly

We've got limited seats. Please do RSVP via this link - http://bit.ly/2buBMaN.

events.name: TechLadies Code Clinic
events.description:
Having problems with your technical task? Need guidance on how to build your app? Join us in this Code Clinic to have your questions answered! We have a group of coaches here to help you. ♥

Please note that this is not a workshop, but a pure Q&A hands-on session. Do remember to bring your laptop and charger!

events.name: Singapore MusicTech - August Meetup
events.description: Venue: Salon du Sens (Nearby MRT: Rochor, Little India) Speakers: Gwen Guo, John Ivers Agenda:  • 6:45pm: Come say hello to each other  • 7:20pm: Intro to Salon du Sens • 7:25pm: Game Audio 101 by Gwen Guo • 7:55pm: Frames: Exploring composition through acoustic spaces by John Ivers About: Gwen Guo is one of 3 co-founders of IMBA Interactive, a small Singapore-based studio that provides end-to-end audio solutions for video games and other media. The goal of IMBA is to contribute high-quality audio to the evolving games industry in Asia, promote good game audio practices in development teams/cycles and educate game developers/students on the value of sound.
events.location: Salon du Sens, 49 Niven Road, Singapore

events.name: HackerNest Singapore August Tech Social
events.description: ***Please note change of date*** Drinks on us. That's right: free beer/water  HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech community. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch, yo), and brimming with UltraSmart(TM) people. We believe that strong, supportive tech communities should exist everywhere - not just in hotspots like San Francisco and New York. Singapore is a tech and startup hub, and HackerNest Singapore connects you with people and companies from all over the world! The typical Tech Social schedule: - 6:30pm: folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize  - 7:30pm: quick intro, thank sponsors - 7:40pm: back to chatting with interesting new friends  - 9:00pm: go home exhausted from great conversations Sponsors make this growing movement possible - email us to chat!  Venue: Skyscanner  Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces that are easily accessible. Get in quick to secure your spot and let the Singapore Tech Community know what you have to offer! Volunteers:  Our awesome Tech Socials are volunteer run, and need people like you! Let us know if you'd like to join the Singapore team! About us: HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials and hackathons. We cram lots of smart, accomplished people into a room with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict no-douchebag policy.
events.location: SkyScanner Ltd, 39 Robinson Road #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #022
events.description:
Paper #1:  A2: Analog Malicious Hardware - Yang K. et al. http://static1.1.sqspcdn.com/static/f/543048/26931843/1464016046717/A2_SP_2016.pdf - Yeo Kheng Meng

Paper #2: Cluster failure: Why fMRI inferences for spatial extent have inflated false-positive rates - Eklund A. et al. http://www.pnas.org/content/early/2016/06/27/1602413113.full - Ivan Vanzaj
-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
